author: admin
title: Calculation for office space may no longer work
text: Apartment Sales Tracker Home / News / Calculation for office space may no longer work Panelists Maria Maughn of HealthPartners, James Norkosky of Thrivent Financial (center), and James Tucker of Target Corp. enjoy a moment of levity — a dance routine by cheerleaders for the Minnesota Vikings — as they prepare to speak Thursday at the CCIM Investment Real Estate Symposium at the DoubleTree hotel in Golden Valley. (Staff photo: Bill Klotz) Calculation for office space may no longer work By: admin October 2, 2015 3:41 pm 0 BY HANK LONG | Staff Writer The typical calculation of 150 square feet of office space per employee may no longer fit as the millennial generation takes over the workplace. That was the consensus of real estate directors from some of the Twin Cities’ largest companies, who spoke Thursday at the 2015 Investment Real Estate Symposium for ...
